Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read confilicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much as a count

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read confilicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read confilicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read confilicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. So the less informed we are about objective information and the more we rely on our own news bubbles we will continue to fracture and the country will suffer terribly because of it. We will

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. So the less informed we are about objective information and the more we rely on our own news bubbles we will continue to fracture and the country will suffer terribly because of it. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. So the less informed we are about objective information and the more we rely on our own news bubbles we will continue to fracture and the country will suffer terribly because of it. We will keep electing leaders with the same misinf

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, if is vital if we are going to live in a functioning democracy, we all need to do our part and keep up with current events but also have the know how to accurately judge between objective reporting and opinionated reporting. We has an information crisis in our country/world right now. There is so much information out there that it is hard to know what to believe. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. The algorithms that feed us news just reinforce what we already believe since we are less likely  to read conflicting information. We are more likely to keep reading about what we already think and believe and then those beliefs just get stronger and stronger. We have come to a point where we can not agree on much anymore and it is tearing us apart. We need to be able to agree on some basic facts and then we can have a conversation about how we should move forward. The disconnect between the urban populations and rural populations are incredible. They believe almost the opposite of what the other believes. Its becoming more like tribalism then activism. So the less informed we are about objective information and the more we rely on our own news bubbles we will continue to fracture and the country will suffer terribly because of it.
